summary: This is a formal discovery request filed by Jeffrey Epstein's defense attorneys (Steptoe & Johnson LLP) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The document requests extensive materials including statements, documents, particulars of the indictment, and Brady material, and references prior investigations and agreements. This is a formal discovery request filed by Jeffrey Epstein's defense attorneys, demanding extensive materials from the government including Brady/Jencks material, witness lists, scientific evidence, grand jury information, and details on surveillance and seized data. It outlines Epstein's legal strategy to challenge evidence and procedural aspects of the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (No. 19-cr-00490) for whom the defense attorneys are submitting this extensive discovery request.

persons.name: Ms. Comey
persons.context: Addressee of the letter at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ms. Moe
persons.context: Addressee of the letter at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Mr. Rossmiller
persons.context: Addressee of the letter at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: Mentioned in reference to his Individual Practices rule (Rule 4.C.3) governing the timing and scope of Brady material disclosures.

persons.name: Patrick Hayes
persons.context: Co-author of a cited news article about New Mexico's investigation into Epstein.

persons.name: Chris Ramirer
persons.context: Co-author of a cited news article about New Mexico's investigation into Epstein.

persons.name: Curt Devine
persons.context: Author of a cited CNN article about a private investigator on Epstein's trail.

persons.name: Nicholas Fandos
persons.context: Author of a cited New York Times article about Democrats demanding documents on the Epstein plea deal.

persons.name: Michael C. Miller
persons.context: One of the attorneys for Jeffrey Epstein who signed the discovery request letter.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: One of the attorneys for Jeffrey Epstein who signed the discovery request letter.

connections.description: Epstein's defense team is formally addressing and making requests to prosecutor Comey.
Epstein's defense team is formally addressing and making requests to prosecutor Moe.
Epstein's defense team is formally addressing and making requests to prosecutor Rossmiller.
Judge Berman is the presiding judge in the case, whose practices are cited regarding Brady material.
Miller is one of the attorneys representing Epstein, as evidenced by his signature on the discovery request.
Weinberg is one of the attorneys representing Epstein, as evidenced by his signature on the discovery request.
Both are defense attorneys for Jeffrey Epstein, co-signing the same legal filing.

events.title: Execution of Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA)
events.description: A non-prosecution agreement was signed between the DOJ and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea in Florida
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty in state court in Palm Beach County, Florida.

events.title: FBI 53-page Indictment Preparation
events.description: The FBI prepared a 53-page indictment against Epstein during this period, as referenced in the discovery request.

events.title: Democrats Demand Briefing on Epstein Deal
events.description: Democrats in Congress demanded a briefing and documents on the Epstein plea deal, as reported in the New York Times.

events.title: New Mexico AG Confirms Evidence Sharing
events.description: The New Mexico Attorney General's office confirmed it would share evidence with New York prosecutors regarding Epstein's alleged New Mexico victims.

events.title: CNN Article on Private Investigator
events.description: CNN published an article about a private investigator who had spent a decade on Jeffrey Epstein's trail.

events.title: Deadline for Jencks Material
events.description: Epstein's defense requests Jencks Act material (witness statements) be provided by this date, or 120 days before any trial date set after June 8, 2020.

events.title: Discovery Request Filed
events.description: Epstein's defense attorneys file a comprehensive discovery request with the government, covering Brady material, Jencks material, scientific evidence, and suppression issues.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The defense is requesting the government to specifically identify the 'dozens of minor girls' and 'multiple minor victims' referenced in the indictment.
The request seeks all documents relating to a '53-page indictment prepared by the FBI' in 2006-2007.
The defense seeks particulars on the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) and the 2008 Guilty Plea in Florida, suggesting these may be grounds for challenging the new prosecution.
The document references investigations by multiple state and local entities including the NYPD, Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office, and New Mexico Attorney General's Office.
The defense requests information to determine if the prosecution was 'initiated as a result of undue political pressure.'
Epstein's defense is aggressively seeking all underlying source material for Brady disclosures, not just summaries, citing DOJ guidance and case law.
The defense requests extensive information on surveillance methods used, including wiretaps, body wires, pen registers, GPS/cell tower data, and the identities of informants or undercover agents.

The filing indicates the government seized materials including computers and electronics, and the defense is concerned about unresponsive data and privileged (attorney-client) data within those seizures.
Epstein's attorneys cite Judge Berman's Individual Practices requiring Brady disclosure within two weeks of discovery, regardless of whether the government 'credits' the material.
The defense requests criminal records of Epstein and any indicted or unindicted co-conspirators, and details on any privilege assertions made during the investigation.
